trustfund:
TF029464-PHRD-DHAKA URBAN TRANSPORT PROJ.,TF033363-BANGLADESH - DHAKA URBAN TRANSPORT,TF035512-BANGLADESH - DHAKA URBAN
            TRANSPORT PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is modest; Bank performance
            is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is unsatisfactory.
            Among the lessons cited were the following: 1) Complex
            project design should be avoided in a weak implementation
            environment. 2) Project objectives and components with TA
            requirements must be clearly aligned. 3) Borrower's
            high ownership and clear leadership are essential to ensure
            progress on significant policy and institutional reform. 4)
            Line of authorities for project management should be clearly
            defined. 5) The independent "Engineer" role should
            be separated from the "Employer" in a complex
            project with weak borrower implementation capacity. That is,
            for agencies with weak contract administration capacity, it
            is important to strongly insist on moving the
            "Engineer" role to an international (definitely
            not local) consulting firm. 6) Clear incentives or penalty
            mechanisms must be enhanced for better consultancy
            services.7) The maximum number of consultant firms forming a
            joint venture must be capped. 8) Wider civil society
            consultation, parallel implementation of social mitigation
            measures and higher quality impact assessment studies are
            essential for potentially controversial measures, such as
            non-motorized transport-free conversion. 9) Car parking
            strategy should be prepared for converted non-motorized
            transport -free streets. 10) Public relations and
            comprehensive communication strategy are particularly
            important for urban transport projects.
